title: Moville to Greencastle Coastal Shore Walk Route

images.title: Bath Green, Moville by Oliver Dixon, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Bath Green, Moville. The small town is located on the western shore of Lough Foyle approximately 30 kilometres from Derry in Northern Ireland. It features a pier and a small, working harbour, reflecting its maritime activities. Moville is well-known for "Moville Green," a large Victorian-style seaside park, which offers several attractions such as bandstands, playgrounds, a putting green, and walking trails. The park is a popular spot for both locals and tourists, particularly for its scenic coastal footpath that provides views across Lough Foyle towards Northern Ireland. Moville’s proximity to a number of beaches also contributes to its popularity as a summer destination for visitors and day-trippers. During the warmer months, the town sees an increase in tourism as people come to enjoy the coastal amenities and the relaxing environment.

description: This popular coastal walk takes you from Moville to Greencastle on the Inishowen Peninsula in County Donegal. The walk starts at the Green in the town of Moville and heads east along the lovely beach to neighbouring Greencastle. Here you'll find a pretty harbour and an interesting Maritime Museum. Along the way there are some lovely views across Lough Foyle towards Northern Ireland. To continue your walking in the area head west to Mamore Gap. There's a good cycling and walking trail taking you through the Gap with great views of the surrounding hills and the Inishowen Peninsula.
